answerText: Aethiopica[10] The childhood of Chariclea parallels that of this character, created by Torquato Tasso.  She converts to Christianity before her death on the battlefield when she is accidentally slain by her beloved Tancred.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 8 | 3 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In this novel, Persinna looks at a marble statue while pregnant, causing her baby to born white and leading her to give it away to Sisimithras.  For 10 points each: [10] Name this work of Heliodorus that ends happily with the union of the protagonist, Chariclea, to her beloved Theagenes.
